army

Class Army

  • java.lang.Object
    • army.Army

  • public class Army
extends java.lang.Object
    Army class is used to create armies with arrays of Actor subclasses using the ArrayList.
    Author:
    Chang Xing Li

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Army(java.lang.String name, Simulator simulator, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Army constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Army

        public Army(java.lang.String name,
            Simulator simulator,
            javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Army constructor. It is used to automatically create an Army. It takes a parameter name to identify the Army created.
        Parameters:
        name - Accepts a string input from the user to give the Army a name.
        simulator -

    • Method Detail

      • getCollectionActors

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Actor> getCollectionActors()
        this gives the collection of actors
        Returns:

      • populate

        public void populate(ActorFactory.Type type,
                     int numToAdd)
        The populate method is used to fill up the Army object that is created. It takes two parameters type and numToAdd.
        Parameters:
        type - This is used to declare what type of Actor subclass object is being used.
        numToAdd - This is used to declare how many instances are to be created to fill up the ArrayList.

      • displayIndividualActor

        public Actor displayIndividualActor(int indexOfActorToEdit)
        The displayIndividualActor method is used to return a specific Actor object from the Army it belongs in. It takes one parameter indexOfActorToEdit.
        Parameters:
        indexOfActorToEdit - This is used to look up the Actor in the ArrayList using the index.
        Returns:
        Actor

      • display

        public void display()
        This is used to display all the Actors and their stats that belong to the Army object.

      • size

        public int size()
        This method is used to return the length of the Army ArrayList in an int value.
        Returns:
        int

      • edit

        public void edit(int indexOfActorToEdit)
        This method is used to make changes to an existing Actor subclass object in the Army. It takes one parameter indexOfActorToEdit.
        Parameters:
        indexOfActorToEdit - This is used to look up the Actor in the ArrayList using the index.
